<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Not that we <em>don’t</em> love answering your questions in the inbox, but we had this thought: What if there were a way to collect the most frequently asked questions from readers, answer them, and put them all in one article on our website? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So, we did that and made an FAQ page. On it, you’ll find answers to questions such as, “How does your referral program work?” and “Do you sell coffee?”</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/21/trial-epic-games-apple?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple and Epic Games Vie for Victory Royale
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/21/trial-epic-games-apple" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Epic Games Apple" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MTc5L2VwaWNfZ2FtZXNfYXBwbGUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A business beef with more leadup than a pay-per-view fight wrapped up its trial yesterday, when Apple CEO Tim Cook took the stand. The kerfuffle started last summer when <em>Fortnite </em>maker Epic Games skirted Apple’s 30% fee for in-game purchases such as hamburger helmets and demogorgon skins.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While we don’t have a verdict yet on whether or not Apple’s App Store policies represent illegal monopolistic behavior, the three-week trial spilled the business world’s equivalent of piping hot tea: Epic’s finances were revealed through court documents. It’s a private company so these are juicy deets, and they made it clear why Epic wants to maximize per-hamburger helmet profit: Epic made 98% of its estimated $9.7 billion in revenue exclusively from <em>Fortnite</em> in 2018 and 2019. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And Apple allegedly took an <a href="https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2021/05/by-the-numbers-what-weve-learned-from-the-epic-games-v-apple-trial/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">outsized bite</a> out of that revenue to unfairly benefit its bottom line. US District Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/05/21/apple-tim-cook-epic-fortnite-trial/?utm_source=morning_brew#link-4ZKCP2IJTBFPTH3GJ6QKPCIEME" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> that Apple makes more money off of gaming apps than any other category, quipping, “You’re charging the gamers to subsidize Wells Fargo.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What did Tim Cook have to say about all this?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He played defense, responding “idk” to several lines of questioning. But when asked about his stance on apps steering customers away from the App Store for purchases (the reason <em>Fortnite</em> was booted off iOS last August), he said, “It would be akin to Apple going down to Best Buy and advertising that you can go across the street to the Apple Store and get an iPhone.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cook also argued that Apple does not closely track the App Store’s profit and loss; in other words, the company’s bean-counting doesn’t interfere with the App Store’s integrity as a marketplace for users to discover apps. Epic’s lawyers pulled up emails suggesting otherwise.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>If Apple loses, it may have to “basically rewrite iOS,” according to <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/4/30/22403862/apple-epic-games-fortnite-app-store-antitrust-trial-kickoff?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Verge</a>. But even if it ends up defeating Epic, this trial has perma-flipped flashlight mode onto Apple’s App Store. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/21/vaccine-tracker-may-22?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vaccine Tracker
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/21/vaccine-tracker-may-22" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Vaccine tracker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjA0L3ZhY2NpbmVfdHJhY2tlci5KUEciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, we’re tossing out the usual Vaccine Tracker format to talk about the main question vexing US health officials: With vaccines widely available, what's the most effective way to motivate people to get a shot?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. Hold a lottery: </strong>Ohio pioneered the tactic with its “Vax-a-Million” lottery awarding $1 million each to five vaccinated residents, and preliminary numbers show it’s working: The state reported a <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/covid-vaccine-ohio-lottery-shots/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">53% week over week increase</a> in first doses administered following the announcement. On Thursday, New York also <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/may/20/new-york-governor-cuomo-covid-vaccine-lottery?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">introduced</a> a lottery incentive for residents to get vaccinated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. Use vaccines as an aphrodisiac</strong>: In <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2021/05/21/tinder-match-bumble-dating-apps-boost-your-covid-19-vaccine-status/5198086001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">partnership</a> with the White House, popular dating apps including Hinge, Tinder, OkCupid, and Bumble will soon introduce features that allow users to a) broadcast they’ve been vaccinated and b) find other vaccinated singles who are down to dose-si-do. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. Go door-to-door: </strong>With more than 60% of adults vaccinated in NYC, public health officials are encouraging community groups to start <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/20/nyregion/vaccine-hesitancy-outreach.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">knocking on doors</a>, specifically in Black and Hispanic neighborhoods where vaccination rates are lower. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/21/tribunes-shareholders-approve-sale-alden?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tribune’s Alden-or-Nothing Vote
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/21/tribunes-shareholders-approve-sale-alden" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="CHICAGO, ILLINOIS - FEBRUARY 17: A sign hangs on the side of the one of ..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MTc2L2NoaWNhZ29fdHJpYnVuZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Scott Olson/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Despite loads of opposition, shareholders <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-74d6e47c6523f0047e058b9646bb2989?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">voted</a> yesterday to approve the sale of Tribune Publishing and its legendary newspaper chain—including the Chicago Tribune, Baltimore Sun, and a number of other local dailies—to Alden Global Capital for $633 million. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unions representing Tribune employees <a href="https://www.chicagotribune.com/business/ct-biz-chicago-tribune-publishing-alden-shareholders-approve-20210521-2awcpedkfrervox7gfsqpm45ua-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew#nt=pf-double%20chain~top-news-duplicate~flex%20feature~curated~alden-fri-1015a~2AWCPEDKFRERVOX7GFSQPM45UA~1~2~2~4~art%20yes" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fought the sale</a> over the last year, fearing the New York hedge fund’s aggressive cost-cutting strategies would lead to job cuts and office closures. The sale ultimately came down to one hotly debated vote from shareholder and LA Times owner Dr. Patrick Soon-Shiong.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Soon-Shiong abstained from the vote, but didn’t actually check the “abstain” box, so it was counted as a “yes.” </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If the “abstain” box would have been checked (even a little bit), it would have been counted as an “against” vote and the sale wouldn’t have been approved.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Alden, which already owns ~200 other local newspapers, has been the Tribune’s largest shareholder since 2019. When the deal is finalized, Alden will take Tribune private and become the second-largest newspaper owner in the country.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> Skyrocketing share prices for vaccine makers have minted <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/05/21/business/covid-vaccine-billionaires/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nine</a> new billionaires in Big Pharma, according to the People’s Vaccine Alliance. Moderna CEO Stéphane Bancel and BioNTech (Pfizer’s vaccine bff) CEO Ugur Sahin are both worth more than $4 billion each.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “Don’t kiss or snuggle backyard poultry.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The CDC told amateur farmers to <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/don-t-kiss-or-snuggle-backyard-poultry-cdc-warns-salmonella-n1268083?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">put those chickens down</a> right this instant after a salmonella outbreak sickened 163 people across 43 states, as of Thursday. Pigeons are still fair game.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read:</strong> In the final installment of our series on Black Wall Street, we collected a list of resources to help you learn more about the Tulsa Race Massacre of 1921. (<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/21/tulsa-race-massacre-learn-happened?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Morning Brew</a>)</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/21/epic-sports-weekend-primer?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Epic Sports Weekend Primer
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Racing </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MTY5L2xld2lzX2hhbWlsdG9uLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>ANDREJ ISAKOVIC/AFP via Getty Images</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After a one-year absence, Formula One returns to the French Riviera for the glamorous Monaco Grand Prix on Sunday. Here’s a <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X_lFFLpHuSQ" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cool video</a> on the logistical challenges of turning the tiny country into a race track. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Golf</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">  <img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MTcwL3BnYV9jaGFtcGlvbnNoaXAuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Keyur Khamar/PGA TOUR via Getty Images</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;">The PGA Championship is entering the third round at the stunning-but-gusty Ocean Course at Kiawah Island in South Carolina. Measuring 7,876 yards, it’s the <a href="https://www.skysports.com/golf/news/14918/12307625/pga-championship-kiawah-island-to-be-7876-yards-and-the-longest-golf-course-in-major-history?utm_source=morning_brew#:~:text=7%2C741%20yards%20%2D%20Erin%20Hills%20Golf,was%20won%20by%20Brooks%20Koepka." target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">longest golf course</a> in major championship history.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0;line-height: 22px;">Basketball</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">  <img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MTcxL21hZGlzb25fc3F1YXJlX2dhcmRlbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>C. Taylor Crothers/Getty Images</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For their (long-awaited) playoff game vs. the Atlanta Hawks on Sunday, the Knicks will <a href="https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/31479832/new-york-knicks-sell-15000-seats-games-1-2-vs-atlanta-hawks-largest-crowd-postseason-far?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">host 15,000 fans</a> at Madison Square Garden. Officials say it will be the largest indoor gathering in NYC since the pandemic began. </p>

FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzMvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other week, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf</a> brings you a few of our favorite, business-related reads. </p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>President and CTO of Greenwood Financial Aparicio Giddins recommends </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780674237476?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Color of Money</em></a></span><span> by Mehrsa Baradaran. To understand the racial wealth gap, you have to understand the segregated economy it was built on.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Augustine Sedgewick’s </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781594206153?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Coffeeland</em></a></span><span><span> explores the brutal history of coffee cultivation in El Salvador and charts how capitalism, geopolitics, and marketing reshaped consumer habits around a cup of brew. </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA business beef with more leadup than a pay-per-view fight wrapped up its trial yesterday, when Apple CEO Tim Cook took the stand. The kerfuffle started last summer when \u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003emaker Epic Games skirted Apple’s 30% fee for in-game purchases such as hamburger helmets and demogorgon skins.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile we don’t have a verdict yet on whether or not Apple’s App Store policies represent illegal monopolistic behavior, the three-week trial spilled the business world’s equivalent of piping hot tea: Epic’s finances were revealed through court documents. It’s a private company so these are juicy deets, and they made it clear why Epic wants to maximize per-hamburger helmet profit: Epic made 98% of its estimated $9.7 billion in revenue exclusively from \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e in 2018 and 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd Apple allegedly took an \u003ca href=\"https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2021/05/by-the-numbers-what-weve-learned-from-the-epic-games-v-apple-trial/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoutsized bite\u003c/a\u003e out of that revenue to unfairly benefit its bottom line. US District Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/05/21/apple-tim-cook-epic-fortnite-trial/?utm_source=morning_brew#link-4ZKCP2IJTBFPTH3GJ6QKPCIEME\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e that Apple makes more money off of gaming apps than any other category, quipping, “You’re charging the gamers to subsidize Wells Fargo.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat did Tim Cook have to say about all this?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHe played defense, responding “idk” to several lines of questioning. But when asked about his stance on apps steering customers away from the App Store for purchases (the reason \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e was booted off iOS last August), he said, “It would be akin to Apple going down to Best Buy and advertising that you can go across the street to the Apple Store and get an iPhone.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCook also argued that Apple does not closely track the App Store’s profit and loss; in other words, the company’s bean-counting doesn’t interfere with the App Store’s integrity as a marketplace for users to discover apps. Epic’s lawyers pulled up emails suggesting otherwise.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eIf Apple loses, it may have to “basically rewrite iOS,” according to \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/4/30/22403862/apple-epic-games-fortnite-app-store-antitrust-trial-kickoff?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThe Verge\u003c/a\u003e. But even if it ends up defeating Epic, this trial has perma-flipped flashlight mode onto Apple’s App Store. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, we’re tossing out the usual Vaccine Tracker format to talk about the main question vexing US health officials: With vaccines widely available, what's the most effective way to motivate people to get a shot?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1. Hold a lottery: \u003c/strong\u003eOhio pioneered the tactic with its “Vax-a-Million” lottery awarding $1 million each to five vaccinated residents, and preliminary numbers show it’s working: The state reported a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/covid-vaccine-ohio-lottery-shots/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e53% week over week increase\u003c/a\u003e in first doses administered following the announcement. On Thursday, New York also \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/may/20/new-york-governor-cuomo-covid-vaccine-lottery?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eintroduced\u003c/a\u003e a lottery incentive for residents to get vaccinated.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2. Use vaccines as an aphrodisiac\u003c/strong\u003e: In \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2021/05/21/tinder-match-bumble-dating-apps-boost-your-covid-19-vaccine-status/5198086001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epartnership\u003c/a\u003e with the White House, popular dating apps including Hinge, Tinder, OkCupid, and Bumble will soon introduce features that allow users to a) broadcast they’ve been vaccinated and b) find other vaccinated singles who are down to dose-si-do. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3. Go door-to-door: \u003c/strong\u003eWith more than 60% of adults vaccinated in NYC, public health officials are encouraging community groups to start \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/20/nyregion/vaccine-hesitancy-outreach.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eknocking on doors\u003c/a\u003e, specifically in Black and Hispanic neighborhoods where vaccination rates are lower. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDespite loads of opposition, shareholders \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-74d6e47c6523f0047e058b9646bb2989?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid and a number of other local dailies—to Alden Global Capital for $633 million. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnions representing Tribune employees \u003ca href=\"https://www.chicagotribune.com/business/ct-biz-chicago-tribune-publishing-alden-shareholders-approve-20210521-2awcpedkfrervox7gfsqpm45ua-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew#nt=pf-double%20chain~top-news-duplicate~flex%20feature~curated~alden-fri-1015a~2AWCPEDKFRERVOX7GFSQPM45UA~1~2~2~4~art%20yes\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efought the sale\u003c/a\u003e over the last year, fearing the New York hedge fund’s aggressive cost-cutting strategies would lead to job cuts and office closures. The sale ultimately came down to one hotly debated vote from shareholder and LA Times owner Dr. Patrick Soon-Shiong.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSoon-Shiong abstained from the vote, but didn’t actually check the “abstain” box, so it was counted as a “yes.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf the “abstain” box would have been checked (even a little bit), it would have been counted as an “against” vote and the sale wouldn’t have been approved.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAlden, which already owns ~200 other local newspapers, has been the Tribune’s largest shareholder since 2019. When the deal is finalized, Alden will take Tribune private and become the second-largest newspaper owner in the country.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F05%2F21%2Ftribunes-shareholders-approve-sale-alden\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
